column4: Hey guys, I have a script launching at boot, in the console, yet it keeps getting interuptted by messages.. how do I turn that off?
anyone know?
What you mean by interrupted?
What messages?
its the kernel messages and its an interactive script, and it puts text all over it
Try passing quiet option to the kernel parameters on boot
ok
What sort of script is yours?
it uses dialog, I made a livecd that boots up to the console, and starts my script which backs up data from a failing Hfsplus volume (mac) and backs it up to a known good drive.
If you are invoking it as initscript, try promoting the order of the start
its not an init script, it launches with bash, it also doesnt matter when it starts, if the kernel spits out a message I am going to see it on screen.
I think that is the case with any application
What kind of message is spit out
In quiet mode kernel doesn't spit unless it is a critical one
like for example, if I plug in a firewire harddrive it starts spitting out sda: ieexxx blah all over the scripty
That is interesting
Normally in quiet mode these messages don't come
ill try it
Please ensure that you have quiet added to the parameters of the kernel
ill try it
OK
